meanings.definition: The condition of being addicted to work.
meanings.sent1: Her workaholism made it difficult for her to relax and enjoy time off.
meanings.sent2: His workaholism often resulted in him staying late at the office.
meanings.sent3: Despite his workaholism, he still found time to enjoy a good book now and then.
meanings.sent4: Her workaholism was like a heavy chain, binding her to her desk day and night.
meanings.sent5: The workaholism of the CEO was legendary, with employees joking that he lived in the office.

meanings.sent1: His workaholism was evident in the long hours he spent at the office.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was partly due to their leader's workaholism.
meanings.sent3: Despite her workaholism, she always made time for her family.
meanings.sent4: The workaholism of the artist was reflected in the intricate details of his paintings.
meanings.sent5: His workaholism was like a fuel that drove him to achieve his goals.
